column4: Like the warning says, back up all data and replace the drive
Files that you don't have read permissions to will not be included in the disk usage in tools looking at individual files
I'm betting there are files in ftp and ftpusers
Please pastebin the output of "du -h /home" and "sudo du -h /home"
I assume that http://pastebin.com/meede822 was the one where du was run as root?

That confirms it, Disk Usage Analizer looks at all of the sizes of all of the files in a given directory to get the size of that directory, if it can't read the file ( i.e. it doesn't have permission to ) then it can't find that file's size
So you have exactly 49 GIG of files that can't be read by the user you are logged in as
What do i do to access my 49 GB of unused space
You don't have 49 GIG of free space, you have 49 GIG of files that can't be read by the user you are logged in as
